title: Choosing a Reconstructive Surgeon
author: Candina Jordan

content: There are a lot of different options when it comes to breast reconstruction after a lumpectomy or mastectomy . If you didn't have reconstruction done at the same time as your mastectomy, a process known as oncoplastic surgery, you may need to choose a reconstructive surgeon . Here are some tips for finding the right one for you:
bullets: Ask trusted members of your medical team or people in your support group for recommendations.
Set up a consultation to make sure you're comfortable with the surgeon before you commit.
Talk to other patients who've had the type of reconstruction surgery you're considering.
Look for a surgeon with a lot of experience in the type of surgery you're having (breast cancer surgery, as well as implants, flap procedure, fat grafting, etc.).
Verify that your surgeon is certified by the American Society of Plastic Surgeons .
Use the consultation appointment to determine if the surgeon's communication style is a good fit for you.
Consider traveling to a larger city if you're having trouble finding a qualified surgeon who makes you feel comfortable.
